1.question: Which component of the AWS Global Infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery? (Select the best answer)

2.question: You can run applications and workloads from a region closer to the end users to _______ latency.

3.question: True / False? Networking, storage, compute and databases are examples of service categories that AWS offers.

4.question: Which of these statements about Availability Zones is not true? (Select the best answer)

options.A: Availability Zones are designed for fault isolation
options.B: Availability Zones are made up of one or more data centers
options.C: Availability zones are connected to each other using high-speed private links
options.D: A data center can be used for more than one availability zone

5.question: What is true about Regions (Choose two)

options.A: They are the physical locations of your customers
options.B: All regions are located in one specific geographic area
options.C: A region is a physical location that has multiple availability zones
options.D: Physical location has multiple availability zones
options.E: Each region is located in a separate geographic area

6.question: Which of the following are geographic areas that host two or more Availability Zones? (Select the best answer)

7.question: _______ means the infrastructure has built-in component redundancy and _______ means that resources dynamically adjust to increases or decreases in capacity requirements.

options.D: Elastic and scalable, no human intervention

8.question: True or False? Availability Zones within a region are connected through low-latency links.

9.question: AWS highly recommends provisioning your compute resources across ____ availability zones.

10.question: True or False? Edge locations are only located in the same general area as regions.
